p: Pelargonium spp. at concentrations ranging between 0.006 and 0.705 mg/mL had no effect on cell viability, while higher concentrations resulted in 85â€“95% cell viability ( Figure 6A). Exposure of cells to Rhus coriaria extract at concentrations between 0.0078125 and 0.5 mg/mL had no effect on cell viability, while higher concentrations resulted in decreased cell viability (up to 15%) compared to the control ( Figure 6B). Viability above 100% (the control), observed at some extract concentrations, can be explained by the absorption of some components within the extracts that had not been washed out.
